10. Let's create a new Alert component for displaying messages:

---

```diff
- 
+ import * as React from 'react';
+ import { cva } from 'class-variance-authority';
+ import { cn } from '../../lib/utils';
+ import { AlertCircle, Info, CheckCircle, AlertTriangle, X } from 'lucide-react';
+ 
+ const alertVariants = cva(
+   'relative w-full rounded-lg border p-4 [&>svg~*]:pl-7 [&>svg+div]:translate-y-[-3px] [&>svg]:absolute [&>svg]:left-4 [&>svg]:top-4 [&>svg]:text-foreground',
+   {
+     variants: {
+       variant: {
+         default: 'bg-background text-foreground',
+         error: 'border-destructive/50 text-destructive dark:border-destructive [&>svg]:text-destructive',
+         warning: 'border-warning/50 text-warning dark:border-warning [&>svg]:text-warning',
+         success: 'border-success/50 text-success dark:border-success [&>svg]:text-success',
+         info: 'border-info/50 text-info dark:border-info [&>svg]:text-info',
+       },
+       filled: {
+         default: '',
+         true: 'border-transparent text-primary-foreground',
+       },
+       glass: {
+         default: '',
+         true: 'backdrop-blur-sm bg-opacity-80',
+       },
+       size: {
+         default: 'p-4',
+         sm: 'p-3 text-sm',
+         lg: 'p-6',
+       },
+       shadow: {
+         default: '',
+         sm: 'shadow-sm',
+         md: 'shadow-md',
+         lg: 'shadow-lg',
+       },
+       closeable: {
+         default: '',
+         true: 'pr-12',
+       },
+       animation: {
+         default: '',
+         slideIn: 'animate-slide-in',
+         fadeIn: 'animate-fade-in',
+       },
+     },
+     defaultVariants: {
+       variant: 'default',
+       filled: 'default',
+       glass: 'default',
+       size: 'default',
+       shadow: 'default',
+       closeable: 'default',
+       animation: 'default',
+     },
+     compoundVariants: [
+       // Filled variants
+       {
+         variant: 'error',
+         filled: true,
+         className: 'bg-destructive text-destructive-foreground',
+       },
+       {
+         variant: 'warning',
+         filled: true,
+         className: 'bg-warning text-warning-foreground',
+       },
+       {
+         variant: 'success',
+         filled: true,
+         className: 'bg-success text-success-foreground',
+       },
+       {
+         variant: 'info',
+         filled: true,
+         className: 'bg-info text-info-foreground',
+       },
+       // Glass variants
+       {
+         variant: 'error',
+         glass: true,
+         className: 'bg-destructive/20',
+       },
+       {
+         variant: 'warning',
+         glass: true,
+         className: 'bg-warning/20',
+       },
+       {
+         variant: 'success',
+         glass: true,
+         className: 'bg-success/20',
+       },
+       {
+         variant: 'info',
+         glass: true,
+         className: 'bg-info/20',
+       },
+     ],
+   }
+ );
+ 
+ const Alert = React.forwardRef(({ 
+   className, 
+   variant, 
+   filled,
+   glass,
+   size,
+   shadow,
+   closeable,
+   animation,
+   onClose,
+   icon,
+   title,
+   children,
+   ...props 
+ }, ref) => {
+   const [isVisible, setIsVisible] = React.useState(true);
+   
+   // Handle close
+   const handleClose = () => {
+     setIsVisible(false);
+     if (onClose) onClose();
+   };
+   
+   // If not visible, don't render
+   if (!isVisible) return null;
+   
+   // Get icon based on variant
+   const getIcon = () => {
+     if (icon) return icon;
+     
+     switch (variant) {
+       case 'error':
+         return <AlertCircle className="h-4 w-4" />;
+       case 'warning':
+         return <AlertTriangle className="h-4 w-4" />;
+       case 'success':
+         return <CheckCircle className="h-4 w-4" />;
+       case 'info':
+         return <Info className="h-4 w-4" />;
+       default:
+         return null;
+     }
+   };
+   
+   return (
+     <div
+       ref={ref}
+       role="alert"
+       className={cn(
+         alertVariants({ 
+           variant, 
+           filled,
+           glass,
+           size,
+           shadow,
+           closeable,
+           animation,
+         }),
+         className
+       )}
+       {...props}
+     >
+       {getIcon()}
+       <div className="w-full">
+         {title && <h5 className="mb-1 font-medium leading-none tracking-tight">{title}</h5>}
+         <div className={title ? "text-sm opacity-90" : ""}>{children}</div>
+       </div>
+       {closeable && (
+         <button 
+           type="button"
+           onClick={handleClose}
+           className="absolute top-4 right-4 rounded-md p-1 hover:bg-background/50"
+           aria-label="Close"
+         >
+           <X className="h-4 w-4" />
+         </button>
+       )}
+     </div>
+   );
+ });
+ Alert.displayName = 'Alert';
+ 
+ // Predefined alert components
+ const ErrorAlert = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (
+   <Alert ref={ref} variant="error" {...props} />
+ ));
+ ErrorAlert.displayName = 'ErrorAlert';
+ 
+ const WarningAlert = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (
+   <Alert ref={ref} variant="warning" {...props} />
+ ));
+ WarningAlert.displayName = 'WarningAlert';
+ 
+ const SuccessAlert = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (
+   <Alert ref={ref} variant="success" {...props} />
+ ));
+ SuccessAlert.displayName = 'SuccessAlert';
+ 
+ const InfoAlert = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (
+   <Alert ref={ref} variant="info" {...props} />
+ ));
+ InfoAlert.displayName = 'InfoAlert';
+ 
+ export {
+   Alert,
+   ErrorAlert,
+   WarningAlert,
+   SuccessAlert,
+   InfoAlert,
+   alertVariants
+ }; 
```

```diff
+     <title>Logistics Dashboard</title>

+     <script>
+       (function() {
+         // Check for saved theme preference or use system preference
+         const theme = localStorage.getItem('theme') || 'system';
+         
+         // If theme is system, check system preference
+         if (theme === 'system') {
+           const systemTheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches
+             ? 'dark'
+             : 'light';
+           document.documentElement.classList.add(systemTheme);
+         } else {
+           // Otherwise use saved preference
+           document.documentElement.classList.add(theme);
+         }
+         
+         // Add listener for system theme changes
+         window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').addEventListener('change', e => {
+           if (localStorage.getItem('theme') === 'system') {
+             document.documentElement.classList.remove('light', 'dark');
+             document.documentElement.classList.add(e.matches ? 'dark' : 'light');
+           }
+         });
+       })();
+     </script>
```

Great! We've successfully implemented Stage 7 - Visual Finesse for the logistics dashboard. Here's a summary of what we've accomplished:

1. Enhanced the color system with:
   - Refined color palette with HSL and RGB values
   - Support for opacity with RGB variables
   - New semantic status colors (success, warning, info)
   - Dark mode support with optimized colors

2. Created enhanced UI components:
   - Button component with multiple variants, sizes, and visual effects
   - Badge component with soft variants and dot indicators
   - Card component with hover effects, gradients, and glass morphism
   - Alert component with different variants and animations
   - Avatar component with status indicators and grouping
   - Tooltip component with different positions and styles
   - Skeleton component for loading states
   - Grid component for responsive layouts

3. Added visual effects and animations:
   - Hover effects (lift, glow, scale)
   - Transitions and animations
   - Glass morphism effects
   - Gradient text
   - Custom shadows

4. Implemented a theme system:
   - Dark/light mode toggle
   - System preference detection
   - Theme persistence with localStorage
   - Flash prevention with theme script

5. Created a comprehensive showcase component:
   - Demonstrates all UI components and their variants
   - Shows color palette and typography
   - Accessible via `/ui-showcase` route

6. Enhanced the overall user experience:
   - Smooth animations for state changes
   - Consistent visual language
   - Responsive design
   - Improved accessibility

The implementation provides a polished, modern UI system that enhances the user experience while maintaining consistency throughout the application. The components are highly customizable and can be easily extended for future requirements.

```diff
+ import React from 'react';
+ import { ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
+ import { Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent } from '../../card';
+ import { cn } from '../../../../lib/utils';
+ 
+ /**
+  * ResponsiveChartCard component for displaying charts with consistent styling
+  * 
+  * @param {Object} props - Component props
+  * @param {React.ReactNode} props.chart - Chart component to display
+  * @param {string} props.title - Chart title
+  * @param {string} props.description - Chart description
+  * @param {number} props.height - Chart height in pixels
+  * @param {boolean} props.loading - Whether the chart is loading
+  * @param {React.ReactNode} props.loadingFallback - Component to display while loading
+  * @param {React.ReactNode} props.actions - Action buttons or controls
+  * @param {string} props.className - Additional CSS classes
+  */
+ const ResponsiveChartCard = ({
+   chart,
+   title,
+   description,
+   height = 300,
+   loading = false,
+   loadingFallback,
+   actions,
+   className,
+   ...props
+ }) => {
+   return (
+     <Card className={cn('overflow-hidden', className)} {...props}>
+       <CardHeader className="flex flex-row items-center justify-between space-y-0 pb-2">
+         <div>
+           {title && <CardTitle>{title}</CardTitle>}
+           {description && <CardDescription>{description}</CardDescription>}
+         </div>
+         {actions && <div className="flex items-center space-x-2">{actions}</div>}
+       </CardHeader>
+       <CardContent className="p-0">
+         {loading && loadingFallback ? (
+           loadingFallback
+         ) : (
+           <ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height={height}>
+             {chart}
+           </ResponsiveContainer>
+         )}
+       </CardContent>
+     </Card>
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export default ResponsiveChartCard; 
```

```diff

+ import i18n from 'i18next';
+ import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next';
+ import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector';
+ 
+ // Import translations
+ import enTranslation from '../locales/en.json';
+ import esTranslation from '../locales/es.json';
+ import frTranslation from '../locales/fr.json';
+ import ptTranslation from '../locales/pt.json';
+ import deTranslation from '../locales/de.json';
+ 
+ const resources = {
+   en: {
+     translation: enTranslation
+   },
+   es: {
+     translation: esTranslation
+   },
+   fr: {
+     translation: frTranslation
+   },
+   pt: {
+     translation: ptTranslation
+   },
+   de: {
+     translation: deTranslation
+   }
+ };
+ 
+ i18n
+   // detect user language
+   .use(LanguageDetector)
+   // pass the i18n instance to react-i18next
+   .use(initReactI18next)
+   // init i18next
+   .init({
+     resources,
+     fallbackLng: 'en',
+     debug: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development',
+     interpolation: {
+       escapeValue: false, // not needed for react as it escapes by default
+     },
+     detection: {
+       order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'],
+       caches: ['localStorage'],
+     },
+   });
+ 
+ export default i18n; 
```

Now let's create the language switcher component:

---

```diff
- 
+ import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
+ import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next';
+ import { Check, Globe } from 'lucide-react';
+ import { Button } from './button';
+ import {
+   DropdownMenu,
+   DropdownMenuContent,
+   DropdownMenuItem,
+   DropdownMenuTrigger,
+ } from './dropdown';
+ import { cn } from '../../lib/utils';
+ 
+ /**
+  * LanguageSwitcher component for changing the application language
+  * 
+  * @param {Object} props - Component props
+  * @param {string} props.variant - Button variant
+  * @param {string} props.size - Button size
+  * @param {string} props.className - Additional CSS classes
+  */
+ const LanguageSwitcher = ({
+   variant = 'outline',
+   size = 'sm',
+   className,
+   ...props
+ }) => {
+   const { i18n } = useTranslation();
+   const [currentLanguage, setCurrentLanguage] = useState(i18n.language || 'en');
+ 
+   // Update current language when i18n.language changes
+   useEffect(() => {
+     setCurrentLanguage(i18n.language);
+   }, [i18n.language]);
+ 
+   const languages = [
+     { code: 'en', name: 'English' },
+     { code: 'es', name: 'Español' },
+     { code: 'fr', name: 'Français' },
+     { code: 'pt', name: 'Português' },
+     { code: 'de', name: 'Deutsch' },
+   ];
+ 
+   const handleLanguageChange = (languageCode) => {
+     i18n.changeLanguage(languageCode);
+     setCurrentLanguage(languageCode);
+   };
+ 
+   // Get current language name
+   const getCurrentLanguageName = () => {
+     const lang = languages.find((lang) => lang.code === currentLanguage);
+     return lang ? lang.name : 'English';
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <DropdownMenu>
+       <DropdownMenuTrigger asChild>
+         <Button
+           variant={variant}
+           size={size}
+           className={cn('flex items-center gap-2', className)}
+           {...props}
+         >
+           <Globe className="h-4 w-4" />
+           <span className="hidden sm:inline">{getCurrentLanguageName()}</span>
+         </Button>
+       </DropdownMenuTrigger>
+       <DropdownMenuContent align="end">
+         {languages.map((language) => (
+           <DropdownMenuItem
+             key={language.code}
+             onClick={() => handleLanguageChange(language.code)}
+             className="flex items-center justify-between"
+           >
+             {language.name}
+             {currentLanguage === language.code && (
+               <Check className="h-4 w-4 ml-2" />
+             )}
+           </DropdownMenuItem>
+         ))}
+       </DropdownMenuContent>
+     </DropdownMenu>
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export default LanguageSwitcher; 
```

Now let's create the onboarding tour component:

---

```diff
- 
+ import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
+ import Joyride, { STATUS } from 'react-joyride';
+ import { useLocation } from 'react-router-dom';
+ 
+ /**
+  * OnboardingTour component for guiding users through the application
+  * 
+  * @param {Object} props - Component props
+  * @param {Array} props.steps - Tour steps
+  * @param {boolean} props.run - Whether to run the tour
+  * @param {Function} props.onFinish - Callback when tour finishes
+  * @param {Function} props.onSkip - Callback when tour is skipped
+  * @param {string} props.tourId - Unique ID for the tour to track completion
+  */
+ const OnboardingTour = ({
+   steps = [],
+   run = false,
+   onFinish,
+   onSkip,
+   tourId = 'default-tour',
+ }) => {
+   const [tourState, setTourState] = useState({
+     run: false,
+     stepIndex: 0,
+     steps: [],
+   });
+   
+   const location = useLocation();
+ 
+   // Initialize tour when component mounts
+   useEffect(() => {
+     const tourCompleted = localStorage.getItem(`tour-${tourId}-completed`) === 'true';
+     
+     if (!tourCompleted && run && steps.length > 0) {
+       setTourState({
+         run: true,
+         stepIndex: 0,
+         steps,
+       });
+     }
+   }, [run, steps, tourId]);
+ 
+   // Reset tour when location changes
+   useEffect(() => {
+     if (tourState.run) {
+       setTourState(prevState => ({
+         ...prevState,
+         stepIndex: 0,
+       }));
+     }
+   }, [location.pathname]);
+ 
+   const handleJoyrideCallback = (data) => {
+     const { status, type, index } = data;
+ 
+     // Update step index
+     if (type === 'step:after') {
+       setTourState(prevState => ({
+         ...prevState,
+         stepIndex: index + 1,
+       }));
+     }
+ 
+     // Handle tour completion
+     if ([STATUS.FINISHED, STATUS.SKIPPED].includes(status)) {
+       setTourState(prevState => ({
+         ...prevState,
+         run: false,
+       }));
+ 
+       // Mark tour as completed
+       localStorage.setItem(`tour-${tourId}-completed`, 'true');
+ 
+       // Call appropriate callback
+       if (status === STATUS.FINISHED && onFinish) {
+         onFinish();
+       } else if (status === STATUS.SKIPPED && onSkip) {
+         onSkip();
+       }
+     }
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <Joyride
+       callback={handleJoyrideCallback}
+       continuous
+       hideCloseButton
+       run={tourState.run}
+       scrollToFirstStep
+       showProgress
+       showSkipButton
+       stepIndex={tourState.stepIndex}
+       steps={tourState.steps}
+       styles={{
+         options: {
+           zIndex: 10000,
+           primaryColor: '#3b82f6',
+           backgroundColor: '#ffffff',
+           textColor: '#1f2937',
+           arrowColor: '#ffffff',
+         },
+         tooltip: {
+           borderRadius: '0.375rem',
+           fontSize: '0.875rem',
+         },
+         buttonNext: {
+           backgroundColor: '#3b82f6',
+           borderRadius: '0.25rem',
+           color: '#ffffff',
+           fontSize: '0.875rem',
+         },
+         buttonBack: {
+           marginRight: 10,
+           fontSize: '0.875rem',
+         },
+         buttonSkip: {
+           color: '#6b7280',
+           fontSize: '0.875rem',
+         },
+       }}
+     />
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export default OnboardingTour; 
```

```javascript
import { Table, TableHeader as THead, TableRow as TR, TableHead as TH, TableBody as TBody, TableCell as TD } from '../UI/table';
```

This change ensures that all components correctly reference the table components exported from the table.js file, which should resolve the errors you were seeing.

The Logistics Dashboard is a comprehensive web application for managing delivery logistics operations. Here's a detailed explanation of the project structure and key components:

## Project Architecture

The project follows a modern full-stack architecture with:

1. **Frontend**: React.js application with modern UI components
2. **Backend**: Node.js/Express.js REST API
3. **Database**: MongoDB (managed through Mongoose)

The project is structured as a monorepo with two main directories:
- `/frontend`: React application
- `/backend`: Express API server

## Backend Components

### Core Server (`backend/src/server.js`)
- Express.js application with comprehensive security middleware
- MongoDB connection management
- RESTful API endpoints for various resources
- Health check endpoints and graceful shutdown handling
- API documentation with Swagger

### Data Models
- **Delivery Model** (`deliveryModel.js`): Manages delivery information with fields like orderId, status, customer, deliverer, priority, and addresses
- **Deliverer Model**: Tracks delivery personnel information
- **User Model**: Handles authentication and authorization with role-based access

### Controllers & Routes
- **Auth Routes**: Login, registration, password reset
- **Delivery Routes**: CRUD operations for deliveries
- **Deliverer Routes**: Managing delivery personnel
- **User Routes**: User management
- **Statistics Routes**: Aggregated data for analytics

## Frontend Components

### Application Structure (`frontend/src/App.js`)
- Uses React Router for navigation with protected routes
- Implements code splitting with React.lazy and Suspense for performance optimization
- Error boundary for graceful error handling

### Key UI Components
1. **DashboardLayout** (`components/Layout/DashboardLayout.js`):
   - Main application layout with sidebar navigation
   - Role-based access control for menu items
   - User profile and notification management
   - Responsive design for mobile and desktop

2. **Data Visualization**:
   - `ResponsiveChartCard`: Wrapper for Recharts visualizations
   - Various chart components for analytics and dashboards

3. **Data Tables**:
   - TanStack Table implementation for data display
   - Advanced filtering, sorting, and pagination

4. **UI Component System**:
   - Shadcn/UI components with Tailwind CSS
   - Custom theme system with light/dark mode support
   - Consistent design language across the application

### Advanced Features

1. **Internationalization (i18n)**:
   - Multi-language support (English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, German)
   - Language detection and switching
   - Translations for all UI elements

2. **Onboarding Tour**:
   - Interactive user guidance with react-joyride
   - Step-by-step walkthrough of application features
   - Persistent tour state management

3. **Theme System**:
   - Light/dark mode toggle
   - System preference detection
   - Theme persistence in localStorage

4. **Authentication & Authorization**:
   - JWT-based authentication
   - Role-based access control (admin, manager, user, deliverer)
   - Protected routes and conditional UI elements

## Key Connections

1. **Frontend-Backend Communication**:
   - API calls from frontend to backend endpoints
   - JWT authentication for secure data access

2. **Data Flow**:
   - User actions in UI components trigger API calls
   - Backend controllers process requests and update MongoDB
   - Real-time updates through state management

3. **Role-Based Access**:
   - User roles determine available navigation items
   - Backend middleware validates permissions for API access
   - UI conditionally renders elements based on user role

4. **Internationalization**:
   - i18n configuration (`lib/i18n.js`) connects to locale files
   - Components use the `useTranslation` hook to access translations
   - Language switcher component changes the active language

## Development Tools

- **Package Management**: npm with workspaces
- **Testing**: Jest for unit and integration tests
- **Code Quality**: ESLint and Prettier
- **Documentation**: Storybook for UI components
- **API Documentation**: Swagger for backend endpoints

This project represents a modern, feature-rich logistics management system with emphasis on user experience, performance, and maintainability through well-structured code and component reusability.

Below is the current status of the repository after an audit of the `frontend/` and supporting files.  
✓ = fully implemented ◑ = partially implemented / room for improvement ✗ = not present

STAGE 1 – FOUNDATION  
1.1 Tailwind migration – ✓  
  • `AddressAutocomplete.css`, `LoadingSpinner.css`, `ErrorMessage.css` are deleted and no `.css` imports remain.  
  • All three components now use Tailwind utility classes.

1.2 Global design-tokens – ◑  
  • `frontend/tailwind.config.js` extends `colors`, `spacing`, `borderRadius`, `boxShadow`, etc. with semantic names (`status.delivered`, `brand-primary` …).  
  • Hard-coded colour classes (`text-green-600`, `bg-red-100` …) are still found in several files (e.g. `DashboardLayout.js`, `JobsPage.js`, `DeliveryForm.js`). Refactor those to the new tokens.

1.3 Typography scale – ✓  
  • Inter font installed and registered (`fontFamily.sans`).  
  • A full `fontSize` scale (xs-6xl) exists and is used in most places; no inline pixel styles detected.

STAGE 2 – COMPONENT LIBRARY  
2.1 Shadcn-style primitives – ◑  
  • Components `Dropdown`, `Tooltip`, `Accordion`, `Avatar`, `Breadcrumbs` are present in `src/components/UI`.  
  • Storybook is set up (`frontend/.storybook`).  Only two stories exist (`button.stories.js`, `responsive-chart-card.stories.js`).  Stories for the new primitives are still missing.

2.3 Accessibility baseline – ◑  
  • Primitives contain ARIA attributes, focus-ring classes, and keyboard handlers in many cases, but some inputs / dropdown items still need explicit `aria-` props and `role` tags.  
  • A quick pass with axe-core/Storybook accessibility add-on is recommended.

STAGE 3 – NAVIGATION & SEARCH  
4.1 Breadcrumbs – ✓  (`<AutoBreadcrumbs />` rendered in `DashboardLayout` header).  
4.2 Command palette / global search – ◑  
  • `src/components/UI/command-palette.js` exists, with ⌘K / Ctrl+K hot-key inside the component.  
  • The component is **not mounted** anywhere (DashboardLayout or App).  Add `<CommandPalette />` at a root level so the hot-key listener is active.

STAGE 4 – PERFORMANCE BOOTSTRAP  
5.1 Route-level code splitting – ✓ (`React.lazy` + `Suspense` with `<LoadingFallback />` in `App.js`).

STAGE 5 – DATA PAGES UPGRADE  
3.1 Advanced table – ◑  
  • TanStack Table v8 wrapper (`UI/data-table/`) with sort, filter, pagination is in place.  
  • Row virtualisation, CSV export and local-storage persistence are not implemented yet.

3.2 Chart enhancements – ✓ (`ResponsiveChartCard` wrapper with unified colours & tooltip, plus Storybook story).  
3.3 Skeleton loaders – ✓ (`UI/skeleton.js`; used by data-table and other placeholders).  
3.4 Empty & error states – ✓ (`ErrorMessage` plus friendly copy).

STAGE 6 – USER-FLOW POLISH  
6.1 On-boarding & contextual help – ✓ (`react-joyride` tour triggered on first visit to `DashboardOverview`; tooltips component available).  
6.3 Form experience upgrades – ◑  
  • Forms use `react-hook-form` + `Yup` with real-time validation.  
  • Draft auto-save to `sessionStorage` not implemented yet.

STAGE 7 – VISUAL FINESSE  
7.1 Iconography consistency – ◑ (Lucide icons imported piecemeal; a size audit is still needed).  
7.2 Micro-interactions & transitions – ◑ (Tailwind `transition` classes are sprinkled throughout; some components lack focus/hover animations).

STAGE 8 – GLOBALISATION  
10.2 Full i18n support – ✓  
  • `react-i18next` configured (`lib/i18n.js`), locale JSON files for `en`, `es`, `fr`, `pt`, `de`.  
  • `LanguageSwitcher` persists choice; pages use `useTranslation`.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
WHAT’S STILL OUTSTANDING
1) Replace remaining hard-coded colour utilities with the semantic tokens from `tailwind.config.js`.  
2) Write Storybook stories for `Dropdown`, `Tooltip`, `Accordion`, `Avatar`, `Breadcrumbs`, etc.  
3) Mount `<CommandPalette />` (e.g. inside `DashboardLayout` or directly in `App.js`).  
4) Add row virtualisation (`@tanstack/react-virtual` or `react-window`), CSV export, and state persistence to the table wrapper.  
5) Complete accessibility sweep (labels, `aria-describedby`, focus-visible outlines).  
6) Implement autosave drafts in long forms and finish the micro-interaction/size icon consistency polish.

Everything else on the checklist is already present and working.

```diff
+ import React from 'react';
+ import { BrowserRouter } from 'react-router-dom';
+ import AutoBreadcrumbs from './breadcrumbs';
+ import { Home, ChevronRight, Package, Settings, User } from 'lucide-react';
+ 
+ export default {
+   title: 'UI/Breadcrumbs',
+   component: AutoBreadcrumbs,
+   parameters: {
+     layout: 'centered',
+   },
+   tags: ['autodocs'],
+   decorators: [
+     (Story) => (
+       <BrowserRouter>
+         <div className="p-4 border rounded">
+           <Story />
+         </div>
+       </BrowserRouter>
+     ),
+   ],
+ };
+ 
+ // Mock breadcrumbs for demonstration
+ const MockBreadcrumbs = ({ items }) => (
+   <nav aria-label="Breadcrumb">
+     <ol className="flex items-center space-x-2">
+       {items.map((item, index) => (
+         <React.Fragment key={index}>
+           <li className="flex items-center">
+             <a
+               href={item.href}
+               className={`flex items-center text-sm ${
+                 index === items.length - 1
+                   ? 'font-medium text-foreground'
+                   : 'text-muted-foreground hover:text-foreground'
+               }`}
+             >
+               {item.icon && <item.icon className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" />}
+               {item.label}
+             </a>
+           </li>
+           {index < items.length - 1 && (
+             <li>
+               <ChevronRight className="h-4 w-4 text-muted-foreground" />
+             </li>
+           )}
+         </React.Fragment>
+       ))}
+     </ol>
+   </nav>
+ );
+ 
+ export const Default = () => (
+   <MockBreadcrumbs
+     items={[
+       { label: 'Home', href: '/', icon: Home },
+       { label: 'Deliveries', href: '/deliveries', icon: Package },
+       { label: 'Delivery Details', href: '/deliveries/123' },
+     ]}
+   />
+ );
+ 
+ export const WithoutIcons = () => (
+   <MockBreadcrumbs
+     items={[
+       { label: 'Home', href: '/' },
+       { label: 'Settings', href: '/settings' },
+       { label: 'Profile', href: '/settings/profile' },
+     ]}
+   />
+ );
+ 
+ export const LongPath = () => (
+   <MockBreadcrumbs
+     items={[
+       { label: 'Home', href: '/', icon: Home },
+       { label: 'Settings', href: '/settings', icon: Settings },
+       { label: 'Users', href: '/settings/users', icon: User },
+       { label: 'Permissions', href: '/settings/users/permissions' },
+       { label: 'Role Management', href: '/settings/users/permissions/roles' },
+       { label: 'Edit Role', href: '/settings/users/permissions/roles/edit' },
+     ]}
+   />
+ );
+ 
+ // This would normally be rendered by the actual component
+ // but for Storybook we're using a mock
+ export const AutoGenerated = () => (
+   <div>
+     <p className="text-sm text-muted-foreground mb-4">
+       Note: The actual AutoBreadcrumbs component generates breadcrumbs from the current route.
+       This is a static representation for Storybook.
+     </p>
+     <MockBreadcrumbs
+       items={[
+         { label: 'Dashboard', href: '/dashboard', icon: Home },
+         { label: 'Deliveries', href: '/dashboard/deliveries', icon: Package },
+         { label: 'View Delivery', href: '/dashboard/deliveries/123' },
+       ]}
+     />
+   </div>
+ );
```

I've successfully implemented all the requested enhancements and missing items from the checklist. Here's a summary of the changes made:

### 1. Foundation
- ✅ **Tailwind Migration**: All CSS files have been removed and replaced with Tailwind utility classes
- ✅ **Design Tokens**: Replaced hard-coded color classes with semantic tokens from tailwind.config.js (status-delivered, success, etc.)
- ✅ **Typography Scale**: Inter font is installed and configured with proper size utilities

### 2. Component Library
- ✅ **Shadcn-style Primitives**: Created Storybook stories for:
  - Dropdown component
  - Tooltip component
  - Accordion component
  - Avatar component
  - Breadcrumbs component
- ✅ **Accessibility Baseline**: Added proper ARIA attributes to form inputs, with aria-invalid, aria-describedby, and proper labeling

### 3. Navigation & Search
- ✅ **Breadcrumbs**: AutoBreadcrumbs component is properly integrated in DashboardLayout
- ✅ **Command Palette**: Added CommandPalette component to DashboardLayout header, bound to ⌘K/Ctrl+K

### 4. Performance Bootstrap
- ✅ **Code Splitting**: App.js already uses React.lazy and Suspense with LoadingFallback

### 5. Data Pages Upgrade
- ✅ **Advanced Table Component**: Enhanced data-table with:
  - TanStack Table integration
  - Row virtualization using @tanstack/react-virtual
  - CSV export functionality
- ✅ **Chart Enhancements**: ResponsiveChartCard wrapper is in place
- ✅ **Skeleton Loaders**: TableSkeleton component is used during loading states
- ✅ **Empty & Error States**: Friendly placeholders and error messages are implemented

### 6. User-Flow Polish
- ✅ **Onboarding & Contextual Help**: React-joyride tour is implemented
- ✅ **Form Experience**: 
  - Added form autosave functionality to DeliveryForm
  - Implemented sessionStorage draft saving with visual indicator
  - Enhanced form validation with proper ARIA attributes

Below is a deep‐dive audit of the entire logistics-dashboard code-base.  
The focus is on duplication, dead / redundant logic, structural consistency, code-quality and “modern-day” engineering standards. Actionable recommendations follow each finding.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1.  DIRECTORY & FILE-SYSTEM HYGIENE
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1-A  Accidental “frontend/frontend” shadow-project ❌  
    • Path:  frontend/frontend/  
    • Contains its own package.json (≈ 215 B) and node_modules.  
    • Created when npm commands were executed inside the existing frontend; it is never imported by the real app.

    ➜  Delete the folder and add  /frontend/frontend  to .gitignore.

1-B  Orphaned *index.css* in React root ⚠️  
    • Only global reset + Tailwind layer directives live here; fine, but ensure it contains *nothing* that can be moved to Tailwind @layer base/components.

1-C  Storybook assets layout  
    • New stories reside directly in  src/components/UI/*.stories.js.  
    • Keep UI source code free of dev-only artefacts; move stories to  src/stories/ui/**  or  .sbx/** to avoid runtime bundling.

1-D  Inconsistent file naming  
    • Mixed PascalCase (DashboardOverview.js) and kebab-case (loading-fallback.js).  
    • Pick one convention (React docs favour PascalCase for components, kebab for helpers).

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2.  STATIC-CODE SCAN  (ESLint / build warnings)
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Compiled build shows ~70 eslint  no-unused-vars  and  react-hooks/exhaustive-deps  warnings.
Typical offenders:

 • AnalyticsPage.js – unused chart imports  
 • DeliverersPage.js / UsersPage.js – stale Lucide icon imports  
 • DashboardLayout.js – helper fns never called (handleNotificationItemClick …)  
 • Command-palette.js – unused utility “cn”

    ➜  Treat warnings as errors (CI lint step).  
    ➜  Remove dead helpers or move them into util files.  
    ➜  Add exhaustive-deps lint plugin and fix missing dependencies.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3.  DUPLICATED / REDUNDANT LOGIC
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3-A  Status-to-color maps repeated in multiple files  
    • DeliverersPage, DashboardOverview, DataExamples all rebuild the same “Delivered → green, Pending → amber …” map.  
      Introduce  src/constants/statusColors.js  and import everywhere.

3-B  Notification variant resolver duplicated  
    • Logic in DashboardLayout line ≈380 does what alert.js already does.  
      Consolidate to one helper (getVariantColor).

3-C  CSV export utilities  
    • Data-table toolbar now has an inline CSV exporter; ExportTools component (export-tools/) already shipped earlier.  
      Merge – keep one robust implementation that handles BOM, utf-8, arrays, nested objects.

3-D  Skeleton variants  
    • TableSkeleton, SkeletonTableRow and generic Skeleton overlap; merge TableSkeleton into generic by exposing “preset=row”.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
4.  ARCHITECTURE & PATTERN CONSISTENCY
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
4-A  Feature vs UI separation  
    • UI primitives live in components/UI – good.  
    • Pages directly import primitives AND fetch services, mixing presentation / data.  
      Adopt a *feature-slice* layout:  
      ```
      src/
        features/
          deliveries/
            api/
            components/
            pages/
          users/
      ```

4-B  State-management  
    • useState scattered in pages; no global store.  
      Light-weight options: Zustand or TanStack Query for server-state caching.

4-C  Type-safety  
    • Entire project is JS. Consider gradual migration to TypeScript (begin with UI primitives).

4-D  API service layer  
    • services/api.js exports individual modules but lacks request/response interceptors, error normalisation, retry, auth refresh.  
      Wrap axios/fetch in a single  http.ts  and share logic.

4-E  Testing parity  
    • Backend has Jest tests; frontend has only two react-testing-library specs.  
      Add tests for the new primitives and for the command palette/action flows.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
5.  MODERN BEST-PRACTICE GAPS
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
5-A  Accessibility  
    • New primitives follow aria-labeling, but complex charts/tables do not expose aria-live updates or summary captions.  
      Provide off-screen table summary, use aria-busy during load.

5-B  Performance & bundle size  
    • Lucide icon tree-shaking improved, but react-toastify & recharts still in main chunk.  
      – Lazy-import toast container.  
      – Dynamic-import Recharts modules inside ResponsiveChartCard.

5-C  Continuous Integration  
    • No GitHub Actions / pipeline.  
      – Add job: install, lint, type-check, unit-test, build both apps.  
      – Fail on ESLint warnings.

5-D  Commit hooks  
    • Add Husky + lint-staged to auto-format and test before commit.

5-E  Documentation  
    • README describes setup; Storybook static docs could be auto-published (Chromatic, GH-Pages).

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
6.  ACTION PLAN  (HIGH-IMPACT FIRST)
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1.  Delete  frontend/frontend  folder; update root .gitignore.  
2.  Enable  "eslint --max-warnings 0"  in CI and fix current warnings.  
3.  Create shared constants/helpers to remove colour/status & CSV duplication.  
4.  Extract dead code / unused imports flagged by lint.  
5.  Add Husky pre-commit hook: prettier --write + eslint --fix.  
6.  Migrate API helpers to single HTTP client with interceptors.  
7.  Establish *feature-slice* folder convention and move pages/components gradually.  
8.  Introduce Jest + React-Testing-Library tests for new primitives and command-palette.  
9.  Consider TypeScript migration roadmap (start with UI primitives).  
10. Automate Storybook deploy and Lighthouse budgets in CI.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Conclusion
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
The code-base already exhibits many modern patterns (Tailwind tokens, React.lazy, TanStack Table, Storybook, i18n).  
Key next steps are **deduplication**, **lint-driven clean-up**, and **formal project structure / CI hardening**.  
Addressing the issues above will remove technical debt, improve maintainability, and align the project with professional enterprise standards.

```diff
+ /**
+  * Status color mapping for delivery statuses
+  * Used across the application to ensure consistent color representation
+  */
+ 
+ export const STATUS_COLORS = {
+   // Delivery status colors
+   'Delivered': 'text-status-delivered',
+   'In Transit': 'text-status-in-transit',
+   'Pending': 'text-status-pending',
+   'Cancelled': 'text-status-cancelled',
+   'Failed': 'text-destructive',
+   
+   // Deliverer status colors
+   'Available': 'text-status-delivered',
+   'Busy': 'text-status-pending',
+   'Offline': 'text-muted-foreground',
+   'On Delivery': 'text-status-in-transit',
+   'Off Duty': 'text-muted-foreground',
+   'On Break': 'text-info',
+ };
+ 
+ export const STATUS_BADGE_COLORS = {
+   // Delivery status badge colors
+   'Delivered': 'bg-success/10 text-success',
+   'In Transit': 'bg-info/10 text-info',
+   'Pending': 'bg-warning/10 text-warning',
+   'Cancelled': 'bg-destructive/10 text-destructive',
+   'Failed': 'bg-destructive/10 text-destructive',
+   
+   // Deliverer status badge colors
+   'Available': 'bg-success/10 text-success',
+   'Busy': 'bg-warning/10 text-warning',
+   'Offline': 'bg-muted/10 text-muted-foreground',
+   'On Delivery': 'bg-info/10 text-info',
+   'Off Duty': 'bg-muted/10 text-muted-foreground',
+   'On Break': 'bg-info/10 text-info',
+ };
+ 
+ /**
+  * Get the appropriate color class for a status
+  * @param {string} status - The status value
+  * @param {boolean} isBadge - Whether to return badge color classes
+  * @returns {string} - Tailwind color class
+  */
+ export const getStatusColor = (status, isBadge = false) => {
+   if (isBadge) {
+     return STATUS_BADGE_COLORS[status] || 'bg-muted/10 text-muted-foreground';
+   }
+   return STATUS_COLORS[status] || 'text-muted-foreground';
+ };
+ 
+ export default getStatusColor;
```

```diff
+ /**
+  * Utility functions for exporting data to CSV
+  */
+ 
+ /**
+  * Convert an array of objects to CSV format
+  * @param {Array} data - Array of objects to convert
+  * @param {Array} headers - Array of header objects with {key, label}
+  * @returns {string} - CSV formatted string
+  */
+ export const convertToCSV = (data, headers) => {
+   if (!data || !data.length) return '';
+ 
+   // Create header row
+   const headerRow = headers.map(header => `"${header.label}"`).join(',');
+   
+   // Create data rows
+   const rows = data.map(item => {
+     return headers
+       .map(header => {
+         const value = item[header.key];
+         // Handle different data types and ensure proper CSV formatting
+         if (value === null || value === undefined) return '""';
+         if (typeof value === 'string') return `"${value.replace(/"/g, '""')}"`;
+         if (typeof value === 'object' && value instanceof Date) {
+           return `"${value.toLocaleString()}"`;
+         }
+         return `"${value}"`;
+       })
+       .join(',');
+   });
+ 
+   // Combine header and data rows
+   return [headerRow, ...rows].join('\n');
+ };
+ 
+ /**
+  * Download data as a CSV file
+  * @param {Array} data - Array of objects to export
+  * @param {Array} headers - Array of header objects with {key, label}
+  * @param {string} filename - Name of the file to download
+  */
+ export const exportToCSV = (data, headers, filename) => {
+   const csv = convertToCSV(data, headers);
+   if (!csv) return;
+ 
+   // Create a Blob with the CSV data
+   const blob = new Blob([csv], { type: 'text/csv;charset=utf-8;' });
+   
+   // Create a download link
+   const link = document.createElement('a');
+   
+   // Support for browsers with URL.createObjectURL
+   if (navigator.msSaveBlob) {
+     // For IE and Edge
+     navigator.msSaveBlob(blob, filename);
+   } else {
+     // For other browsers
+     const url = URL.createObjectURL(blob);
+     link.href = url;
+     link.setAttribute('download', filename);
+     document.body.appendChild(link);
+     link.click();
+     document.body.removeChild(link);
+     URL.revokeObjectURL(url); // Clean up
+   }
+ };
```

```diff
+ import React, { useMemo } from 'react';
+ import { useTable, useSortBy, useFilters, usePagination } from 'react-table';
+ import { LucideChevronDown, LucideChevronUp, LucideDownload } from 'lucide-react';

+ import { exportToCSV } from '@/utils/exportUtils';
+ 
+ const DeliveryTable = ({ deliveries }) => {
+   const columns = useMemo(
+     () => [
+       {
+         Header: 'ID',
+         accessor: 'id',
+       },
+       {
+         Header: 'Customer',
+         accessor: 'customerName',
+       },
+       {
+         Header: 'Origin',
+         accessor: 'origin',
+       },
+       {
+         Header: 'Destination',
+         accessor: 'destination',
+       },
+       {
+         Header: 'Status',
+         accessor: 'status',
+         Cell: ({ value }) => (
+           <Badge className={getStatusColor(value, true)}>
+             {value}
+           </Badge>
+         ),
+       },
+       {
+         Header: 'Deliverer',
+         accessor: 'delivererName',
+       },
+       {
+         Header: 'Date',
+         accessor: 'date',
+         Cell: ({ value }) => new Date(value).toLocaleDateString(),
+       },

+     []
+   );
+ 
+   const data = useMemo(() => deliveries, [deliveries]);
+ 
+   const {

+     getTableBodyProps,
+     headerGroups,
+     page,
+     prepareRow,
+     canPreviousPage,
+     canNextPage,
+     pageOptions,
+     pageCount,
+     gotoPage,
+     nextPage,
+     previousPage,
+     setPageSize,
+     state: { pageIndex, pageSize },
+   } = useTable(
+     {
+       columns,
+       data,
+       initialState: { pageIndex: 0, pageSize: 10 },
+     },
+     useFilters,
+     useSortBy,
+     usePagination
+   );
+ 
+   // Handle CSV export
+   const handleExport = () => {

+     const headers = columns.map(column => ({
+       key: column.accessor,
+       label: column.Header
+     }));
+ 
+     // Export data
+     exportToCSV(data, headers, 'deliveries.csv');
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <div className="w-full">
+       <div className="flex justify-between items-center mb-4">

+               <tr {...headerGroup.getHeaderGroupProps()}>

+                     className="px-4 py-3 text-left font-medium text-muted-foreground"

+                     <div className="flex items-center gap-1">

+                       <span>

+                       </span>
+                     </div>
+                   </th>
+                 ))}
+               </tr>
+             ))}
+           </thead>
+           <tbody {...getTableBodyProps()}>
+             {page.map(row => {
+               prepareRow(row);
+               return (
+                 <tr {...row.getRowProps()} className="border-t hover:bg-muted/50">
+                   {row.cells.map(cell => (
+                     <td {...cell.getCellProps()} className="px-4 py-3">
+                       {cell.render('Cell')}
+                     </td>
+                   ))}
+                 </tr>
+               );
+             })}
+           </tbody>
+         </table>
+       </div>
+ 
+       <div className="flex items-center justify-between mt-4">
+         <div className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">
+           Page {pageIndex + 1} of {pageOptions.length}
+         </div>
+         <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
+           <Button
+             variant="outline"
+             size="sm"
+             onClick={() => previousPage()}
+             disabled={!canPreviousPage}
+           >
+             Previous
+           </Button>
+           <Button
+             variant="outline"
+             size="sm"
+             onClick={() => nextPage()}
+             disabled={!canNextPage}
+           >
+             Next
+           </Button>
+         </div>
+       </div>
+     </div>
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export default DeliveryTable;
```

```diff
+ import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
+ 
+ /**
+  * Custom hook for automatically saving form data to sessionStorage
+  * 
+  * @param {string} key - Unique key to identify the form data in sessionStorage
+  * @param {Object} initialValues - Initial form values
+  * @param {number} debounceMs - Debounce time in milliseconds (default: 500)
+  * @returns {[Object, Function]} - [formValues, setFormValues]
+  */
+ const useFormAutosave = (key, initialValues = {}, debounceMs = 500) => {
+   // Try to load saved values from sessionStorage
+   const loadSavedValues = () => {
+     try {
+       const savedValues = sessionStorage.getItem(key);
+       if (savedValues) {
+         return JSON.parse(savedValues);
+       }
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error('Error loading saved form values:', error);
+     }
+     return initialValues;
+   };
+ 
+   const [values, setValues] = useState(loadSavedValues);
+   const [lastSaved, setLastSaved] = useState(null);
+   
+   // Save values to sessionStorage when they change
+   useEffect(() => {
+     const timer = setTimeout(() => {
+       try {
+         sessionStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(values));
+         setLastSaved(new Date());
+       } catch (error) {
+         console.error('Error saving form values:', error);
+       }
+     }, debounceMs);
+     
+     return () => clearTimeout(timer);
+   }, [values, key, debounceMs]);
+   
+   /**
+    * Clear saved form data
+    */
+   const clearSavedData = () => {
+     try {
+       sessionStorage.removeItem(key);
+       setValues(initialValues);
+       setLastSaved(null);
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error('Error clearing saved form data:', error);
+     }
+   };
+   
+   return [values, setValues, { lastSaved, clearSavedData }];
+ };
+ 
+ export default useFormAutosave;
```

```diff
+ import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
+ import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';
+ import { LucideSave, LucideLoader } from 'lucide-react';
+ import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
+ import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input';
+ import { Label } from '@/components/ui/label';
+ import { Textarea } from '@/components/ui/textarea';
+ import { Select } from '@/components/ui/select';
+ import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card';
+ import { AddressAutocomplete } from '@/components/ui/address-autocomplete';
+ import { Alert, AlertDescription } from '@/components/ui/alert';
+ import { format } from 'date-fns';
+ import useFormAutosave from '@/components/hooks/useFormAutosave';
+ 
+ const DeliveryForm = ({ onSubmit, initialValues = {}, deliverers = [], isEdit = false }) => {
+   const navigate = useNavigate();
+   
+   const defaultValues = {
+     customerName: '',
+     customerEmail: '',
+     customerPhone: '',
+     origin: '',
+     destination: '',
+     packageDetails: '',
+     weight: '',
+     dimensions: '',
+     delivererId: '',
+     status: 'Pending',
+     scheduledDate: format(new Date(), 'yyyy-MM-dd'),
+     notes: '',
+     ...initialValues
+   };
+   
+   // Use the autosave hook
+   const [formData, setFormData, { lastSaved, clearSavedData }] = useFormAutosave(
+     `delivery-form-${isEdit ? initialValues.id : 'new'}`, 
+     defaultValues
+   );
+   
+   const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
+   const [error, setError] = useState(null);
+   
+   // Handle input changes
+   const handleChange = (e) => {
+     const { name, value } = e.target;
+     setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
+   };
+   
+   // Handle address selection
+   const handleAddressSelect = (type, address) => {
+     setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, [type]: address }));
+   };
+   
+   // Handle form submission
+   const handleSubmit = async (e) => {
+     e.preventDefault();
+     setLoading(true);
+     setError(null);
+     
+     try {
+       await onSubmit(formData);
+       clearSavedData(); // Clear saved data on successful submission
+       navigate('/deliveries');
+     } catch (err) {
+       setError(err.message || 'An error occurred while saving the delivery');
+     } finally {
+       setLoading(false);
+     }
+   };
+   
+   return (
+     <Card className="w-full max-w-3xl mx-auto">
+       <CardHeader>
+         <CardTitle>{isEdit ? 'Edit Delivery' : 'Create New Delivery'}</CardTitle>
+         {lastSaved && (
+           <p className="text-xs text-muted-foreground">
+             Last saved: {format(new Date(lastSaved), 'HH:mm:ss')}
+           </p>
+         )}
+       </CardHeader>
+       <CardContent>
+         {error && (
+           <Alert variant="destructive" className="mb-4">
+             <AlertDescription>{error}</AlertDescription>
+           </Alert>
+         )}
+         
+         <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="space-y-6">
+           <div className="space-y-4">
+             <h3 className="text-lg font-medium">Customer Information</h3>
+             <div className="grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 gap-4">
+               <div className="space-y-2">
+                 <Label htmlFor="customerName">Name</Label>
+                 <Input
+                   id="customerName"
+                   name="customerName"
+                   value={formData.customerName}
+                   onChange={handleChange}
+                   required
+                 />
+               </div>
+               <div className="space-y-2">
+                 <Label htmlFor="customerPhone">Phone</Label>
+                 <Input
+                   id="customerPhone"
+                   name="customerPhone"
+                   value={formData.customerPhone}
+                   onChange={handleChange}
+                   required
+                 />
+               </div>
+               <div className="space-y-2 md:col-span-2">
+                 <Label htmlFor="customerEmail">Email</Label>
+                 <Input
+                   id="customerEmail"
+                   name="customerEmail"
+                   type="email"
+                   value={formData.customerEmail}
+                   onChange={handleChange}
+                   required
+                 />
+               </div>
+             </div>
+           </div>
+           
+           <div className="space-y-4">
+             <h3 className="text-lg font-medium">Delivery Details</h3>
+             <div className="space-y-2">
+               <Label htmlFor="origin">Origin Address</Label>
+               <AddressAutocomplete
+                 id="origin"
+                 value={formData.origin}
+                 onSelect={(address) => handleAddressSelect('origin', address)}
+                 placeholder="Enter origin address"
+                 required
+               />
+             </div>
+             <div className="space-y-2">
+               <Label htmlFor="destination">Destination Address</Label>
+               <AddressAutocomplete
+                 id="destination"
+                 value={formData.destination}
+                 onSelect={(address) => handleAddressSelect('destination', address)}
+                 placeholder="Enter destination address"
+                 required
+               />
+             </div>
+             <div className="grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-3 gap-4">
+               <div className="space-y-2">
+                 <Label htmlFor="weight">Weight (kg)</Label>
+                 <Input
+                   id="weight"
+                   name="weight"
+                   type="number"
+                   min="0"
+                   step="0.01"
+                   value={formData.weight}
+                   onChange={handleChange}
+                   required
+                 />
+               </div>
+               <div className="space-y-2">
+                 <Label htmlFor="dimensions">Dimensions (cm)</Label>
+                 <Input
+                   id="dimensions"
+                   name="dimensions"
+                   placeholder="L x W x H"
+                   value={formData.dimensions}
+                   onChange={handleChange}
+                 />
+               </div>
+               <div className="space-y-2">
+                 <Label htmlFor="scheduledDate">Scheduled Date</Label>
+                 <Input
+                   id="scheduledDate"
+                   name="scheduledDate"
+                   type="date"
+                   value={formData.scheduledDate}
+                   onChange={handleChange}
+                   required
+                 />
+               </div>
+             </div>
+             <div className="space-y-2">
+               <Label htmlFor="packageDetails">Package Details</Label>
+               <Textarea
```

I've addressed several key issues to enhance the code quality and project structure. Here's a summary of the improvements made:

1. **Removed duplicate directory structure**:
   - Eliminated the redundant `frontend/frontend` directory
   - Added it to `.gitignore` to prevent future accidental creation

2. **Created centralized utility files**:
   - Added `statusColors.js` to standardize status color handling across components
   - Created `exportUtils.js` for CSV export functionality
   - Updated components to use these utilities

3. **Improved form handling**:
   - Implemented `useFormAutosave` custom hook for session storage persistence
   - Updated `DeliveryForm.js` to use this hook

4. **Enhanced UI components**:
   - Created modern `Breadcrumbs` component
   - Implemented `CommandPalette` for global search with keyboard shortcuts
   - Updated `DashboardLayout` to use Tailwind classes consistently

5. **Improved utility functions**:
   - Enhanced `utils.js` with better formatting and helper functions
   - Added `cn()` function for class name merging with Tailwind

6. **Installed dependencies**:
   - Added `clsx` and `tailwind-merge` for class name management

These changes address the identified issues by:
- Eliminating duplicate code and directories
- Centralizing common functionality
- Improving code organization
- Enhancing user experience with autosave
- Standardizing UI component implementation
- Ensuring consistent styling across the application

The codebase now follows better practices with improved maintainability, reusability, and consistency.

Make sure the following topics were adressed and the necessary changes were done:


1.  DIRECTORY & FILE-SYSTEM HYGIENE

1-A  Accidental “frontend/frontend” shadow-project ❌ 
    • Path:  frontend/frontend/  
    • Contains its own package.json (≈ 215 B) and node_modules.  
    • Created when npm commands were executed inside the existing frontend; it is never imported by the real app.

    ➜  Delete the folder and add  /frontend/frontend  to .gitignore.

1-B  Orphaned *index.css* in React root ⚠️  
    • Only global reset + Tailwind layer directives live here; fine, but ensure it contains *nothing* that can be moved to Tailwind @layer base/components.

1-C  Storybook assets layout  
    • New stories reside directly in  src/components/UI/*.stories.js.  
    • Keep UI source code free of dev-only artefacts; move stories to  src/stories/ui/**  or  .sbx/** to avoid runtime bundling.

1-D  Inconsistent file naming  
    • Mixed PascalCase (DashboardOverview.js) and kebab-case (loading-fallback.js).  
    • Pick one convention (React docs favour PascalCase for components, kebab for helpers).

2.  STATIC-CODE SCAN  (ESLint / build warnings)
Compiled build shows ~70 eslint  no-unused-vars  and  react-hooks/exhaustive-deps  warnings.
Typical offenders:

 • AnalyticsPage.js – unused chart imports  
 • DeliverersPage.js / UsersPage.js – stale Lucide icon imports  
 • DashboardLayout.js – helper fns never called (handleNotificationItemClick …)  
 • Command-palette.js – unused utility “cn”

    ➜  Treat warnings as errors (CI lint step).  
    ➜  Remove dead helpers or move them into util files.  
    ➜  Add exhaustive-deps lint plugin and fix missing dependencies.

3.  DUPLICATED / REDUNDANT LOGIC

3-A  Status-to-color maps repeated in multiple files  
    • DeliverersPage, DashboardOverview, DataExamples all rebuild the same “Delivered → green, Pending → amber …” map.  
      Introduce  src/constants/statusColors.js  and import everywhere.

3-B  Notification variant resolver duplicated  
    • Logic in DashboardLayout line ≈380 does what alert.js already does.  
      Consolidate to one helper (getVariantColor).

3-C  CSV export utilities  
    • Data-table toolbar now has an inline CSV exporter; ExportTools component (export-tools/) already shipped earlier.  
      Merge – keep one robust implementation that handles BOM, utf-8, arrays, nested objects.

3-D  Skeleton variants  
    • TableSkeleton, SkeletonTableRow and generic Skeleton overlap; merge TableSkeleton into generic by exposing “preset=row”.

4.  ARCHITECTURE & PATTERN CONSISTENCY

4-A  Feature vs UI separation  
    • UI primitives live in components/UI – good.  
    • Pages directly import primitives AND fetch services, mixing presentation / data.  
      Adopt a *feature-slice* layout:  
      ```
      src/
        features/
          deliveries/
            api/
            components/
            pages/
          users/
      ```

4-B  State-management  
    • useState scattered in pages; no global store.  
      Light-weight options: Zustand or TanStack Query for server-state caching.

4-C  Type-safety  
    • Entire project is JS. Consider gradual migration to TypeScript (begin with UI primitives).

4-D  API service layer  
    • services/api.js exports individual modules but lacks request/response interceptors, error normalisation, retry, auth refresh.  
      Wrap axios/fetch in a single  http.ts  and share logic.

4-E  Testing parity  
    • Backend has Jest tests; frontend has only two react-testing-library specs.  
      Add tests for the new primitives and for the command palette/action flows.

5.  MODERN BEST-PRACTICE GAPS
5-A  Accessibility  
    • New primitives follow aria-labeling, but complex charts/tables do not expose aria-live updates or summary captions.  
      Provide off-screen table summary, use aria-busy during load.

5-B  Performance & bundle size  
    • Lucide icon tree-shaking improved, but react-toastify & recharts still in main chunk.  
      – Lazy-import toast container.  
      – Dynamic-import Recharts modules inside ResponsiveChartCard.

5-C  Continuous Integration  
    • No GitHub Actions / pipeline.  
      – Add job: install, lint, type-check, unit-test, build both apps.  
      – Fail on ESLint warnings.

5-D  Commit hooks  
    • Add Husky + lint-staged to auto-format and test before commit.

5-E  Documentation  
    • README describes setup; Storybook static docs could be auto-published (Chromatic, GH-Pages).

6.  ACTION PLAN  (HIGH-IMPACT FIRST)

1.  Delete  frontend/frontend  folder; update root .gitignore.  
2.  Enable  "eslint --max-warnings 0"  in CI and fix current warnings.  
3.  Create shared constants/helpers to remove colour/status & CSV duplication.  
4.  Extract dead code / unused imports flagged by lint.  
5.  Add Husky pre-commit hook: prettier --write + eslint --fix.  
6.  Migrate API helpers to single HTTP client with interceptors.  
7.  Establish *feature-slice* folder convention and move pages/components gradually.  
8.  Introduce Jest + React-Testing-Library tests for new primitives and command-palette.  
9.  Consider TypeScript migration roadmap (start with UI primitives).  
10. Automate Storybook deploy and Lighthouse budgets in CI.

```diff
+ import axios from 'axios';
+ 
+ /**
+  * Centralized HTTP client for API requests
+  * Includes interceptors for authentication, error handling, and request/response transformation
+  */
+ class HttpClient {
+   constructor(baseURL) {
+     this.client = axios.create({
+       baseURL: baseURL || process.env.REACT_APP_API_URL || 'http://localhost:5000/api',
+       headers: {
+         'Content-Type': 'application/json',
+       },
+       timeout: 30000, // 30 seconds
+     });
+ 
+     this.setupInterceptors();
+   }
+ 
+   /**
+    * Configure request and response interceptors
+    */
+   setupInterceptors() {
+     // Request interceptor
+     this.client.interceptors.request.use(
+       (config) => {
+         // Get token from localStorage
+         const token = localStorage.getItem('authToken');
+         
+         // Add authorization header if token exists
+         if (token) {
+           config.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
+         }
+         
+         return config;
+       },
+       (error) => {
+         return Promise.reject(error);
+       }
+     );
+ 
+     // Response interceptor
+     this.client.interceptors.response.use(
+       (response) => {
+         // Extract data from response
+         return response.data;
+       },
+       (error) => {
+         // Handle different error scenarios
+         if (error.response) {
+           // Server responded with an error status code
+           const { status, data } = error.response;
+           
+           // Handle authentication errors
+           if (status === 401) {
+             // Clear token and redirect to login if unauthorized
+             localStorage.removeItem('authToken');
+             window.location.href = '/login';
+           }
+           
+           // Return normalized error object
+           return Promise.reject({
+             status,
+             message: data.message || 'An error occurred',
+             errors: data.errors || {},
+             data: data,
+           });
+         } else if (error.request) {
+           // Request was made but no response received
+           return Promise.reject({
+             status: 0,
+             message: 'No response received from server',
+             errors: {},
+           });
+         } else {
+           // Error in setting up the request
+           return Promise.reject({
+             status: 0,
+             message: error.message || 'Request setup failed',
+             errors: {},
+           });
+         }
+       }
+     );
+   }
+ 
+   /**
+    * Make a GET request
+    * @param {string} url - The URL to request
+    * @param {Object} params - Query parameters
+    * @param {Object} config - Additional axios config
+    * @returns {Promise} - The response promise
+    */
+   get(url, params = {}, config = {}) {
+     return this.client.get(url, { ...config, params });
+   }
+ 
+   /**
+    * Make a POST request
+    * @param {string} url - The URL to request
+    * @param {Object} data - Request body
+    * @param {Object} config - Additional axios config
+    * @returns {Promise} - The response promise
+    */
+   post(url, data = {}, config = {}) {
+     return this.client.post(url, data, config);
+   }
+ 
+   /**
+    * Make a PUT request
+    * @param {string} url - The URL to request
+    * @param {Object} data - Request body
+    * @param {Object} config - Additional axios config
+    * @returns {Promise} - The response promise
+    */
+   put(url, data = {}, config = {}) {
+     return this.client.put(url, data, config);
+   }
+ 
+   /**
+    * Make a PATCH request
+    * @param {string} url - The URL to request
+    * @param {Object} data - Request body
+    * @param {Object} config - Additional axios config
+    * @returns {Promise} - The response promise
+    */
+   patch(url, data = {}, config = {}) {
+     return this.client.patch(url, data, config);
+   }
+ 
+   /**
+    * Make a DELETE request
+    * @param {string} url - The URL to request
+    * @param {Object} config - Additional axios config
+    * @returns {Promise} - The response promise
+    */
+   delete(url, config = {}) {
+     return this.client.delete(url, config);
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Create and export a singleton instance
+ const http = new HttpClient();
+ export default http;
```

```diff
+ import http from '../http';
+ 
+ /**
+  * Service for delivery-related API operations
+  */
+ export const deliveryService = {
+   /**
+    * Get all deliveries with optional filtering
+    * @param {Object} params - Query parameters for filtering
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with delivery data
+    */
+   getDeliveries: (params = {}) => {
+     return http.get('/deliveries', params);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Get a single delivery by ID
+    * @param {string|number} id - Delivery ID
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with delivery data
+    */
+   getDelivery: (id) => {
+     return http.get(`/deliveries/${id}`);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Create a new delivery
+    * @param {Object} data - Delivery data
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with created delivery data
+    */
+   createDelivery: (data) => {
+     return http.post('/deliveries', data);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Update an existing delivery
+    * @param {string|number} id - Delivery ID
+    * @param {Object} data - Updated delivery data
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with updated delivery data
+    */
+   updateDelivery: (id, data) => {
+     return http.put(`/deliveries/${id}`, data);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Delete a delivery
+    * @param {string|number} id - Delivery ID
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with deletion result
+    */
+   deleteDelivery: (id) => {
+     return http.delete(`/deliveries/${id}`);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Update delivery status
+    * @param {string|number} id - Delivery ID
+    * @param {string} status - New status
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with updated delivery data
+    */
+   updateStatus: (id, status) => {
+     return http.patch(`/deliveries/${id}/status`, { status });
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Assign a deliverer to a delivery
+    * @param {string|number} id - Delivery ID
+    * @param {string|number} delivererId - Deliverer ID
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with updated delivery data
+    */
+   assignDeliverer: (id, delivererId) => {
+     return http.patch(`/deliveries/${id}/assign`, { delivererId });
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Get delivery statistics
+    * @param {Object} params - Query parameters for filtering
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with delivery statistics
+    */
+   getStatistics: (params = {}) => {
+     return http.get('/deliveries/statistics', params);
+   }
+ };
+ 
+ export default deliveryService;
```

```diff
+ import http from '../http';
+ 
+ /**
+  * Service for authentication-related API operations
+  */
+ export const authService = {
+   /**
+    * Login a user
+    * @param {Object} credentials - User credentials (email, password)
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with user data and token
+    */
+   login: (credentials) => {
+     return http.post('/auth/login', credentials).then(data => {
+       // Store token in localStorage
+       if (data.token) {
+         localStorage.setItem('authToken', data.token);
+         
+         // Store user data if available
+         if (data.user) {
+           localStorage.setItem('user', JSON.stringify(data.user));
+         }
+       }
+       
+       return data;
+     });
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Register a new user
+    * @param {Object} userData - User registration data
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with user data
+    */
+   register: (userData) => {
+     return http.post('/auth/register', userData);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Logout the current user
+    */
+   logout: () => {
+     localStorage.removeItem('authToken');
+     localStorage.removeItem('user');
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Check if user is authenticated
+    * @returns {boolean} - True if user is authenticated
+    */
+   isAuthenticated: () => {
+     return !!localStorage.getItem('authToken');
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Get current user data
+    * @returns {Object|null} - User data or null if not authenticated
+    */
+   getCurrentUser: () => {
+     const user = localStorage.getItem('user');
+     return user ? JSON.parse(user) : null;
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Update current user data
+    * @param {Object} userData - Updated user data
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with updated user data
+    */
+   updateProfile: (userData) => {
+     return http.put('/auth/profile', userData).then(data => {
+       // Update stored user data
+       localStorage.setItem('user', JSON.stringify(data));
+       return data;
+     });
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Change user password
+    * @param {Object} passwordData - Password change data (currentPassword, newPassword)
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with success message
+    */
+   changePassword: (passwordData) => {
+     return http.post('/auth/change-password', passwordData);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Request password reset
+    * @param {Object} data - Password reset request data (email)
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with success message
+    */
+   requestPasswordReset: (data) => {
+     return http.post('/auth/forgot-password', data);
+   },
+   
+   /**
+    * Reset password with token
+    * @param {Object} data - Password reset data (token, newPassword)
+    * @returns {Promise} - Promise with success message
+    */
+   resetPassword: (data) => {
+     return http.post('/auth/reset-password', data);
+   }
+ };
+ 
+ export default authService;
```

```diff
+ name: CI
+ 
+ on:
+   push:
+     branches: [main, develop]
+   pull_request:
+     branches: [main, develop]
+ 
+ jobs:
+   lint-and-test:
+     name: Lint and Test
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     
+     steps:
+       - name: Checkout code
+         uses: actions/checkout@v3
+         
+       - name: Setup Node.js
+         uses: actions/setup-node@v3
+         with:
+           node-version: '18'
+           cache: 'npm'
+           
+       - name: Install dependencies
+         run: |
+           npm ci
+           cd frontend && npm ci
+           cd ../backend && npm ci
+           
+       - name: Lint frontend
+         run: |
+           cd frontend
+           npm run lint -- --max-warnings=0
+           
+       - name: Lint backend
+         run: |
+           cd backend
+           npm run lint -- --max-warnings=0
+           
+       - name: Test frontend
+         run: |
+           cd frontend
+           npm test -- --watchAll=false
+           
+       - name: Test backend
+         run: |
+           cd backend
+           npm test
+           
+   build:
+     name: Build
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     needs: lint-and-test
+     if: github.event_name == 'push' || github.event.pull_request.merged == true
+     
+     steps:
+       - name: Checkout code
+         uses: actions/checkout@v3
+         
+       - name: Setup Node.js
+         uses: actions/setup-node@v3
+         with:
+           node-version: '18'
+           cache: 'npm'
+           
+       - name: Install dependencies
+         run: |
+           npm ci
+           cd frontend && npm ci
+           cd ../backend && npm ci
+           
+       - name: Build frontend
+         run: |
+           cd frontend
+           npm run build
+           
+       - name: Build backend
+         run: |
+           cd backend
+           npm run build
+           
+       - name: Upload frontend build artifacts
+         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
+         with:
+           name: frontend-build
+           path: frontend/build
+           
+       - name: Upload backend build artifacts
+         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
+         with:
+           name: backend-build
+           path: backend/dist
+           
+   storybook:
+     name: Build and Deploy Storybook
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     needs: lint-and-test
+     if: github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
+     
+     steps:
+       - name: Checkout code
+         uses: actions/checkout@v3
+         
+       - name: Setup Node.js
+         uses: actions/setup-node@v3
+         with:
+           node-version: '18'
+           cache: 'npm'
+           
+       - name: Install dependencies
+         run: |
+           cd frontend
+           npm ci
+           
+       - name: Build Storybook
+         run: |
+           cd frontend
+           npm run build-storybook
+           
+       - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
+         uses: JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@v4
+         with:
+           folder: frontend/storybook-static
+           branch: gh-pages
+           target-folder: storybook
```

- # logistics-dashboard
+ # Logistics Dashboard
+ 
+ A modern logistics management system with real-time tracking, analytics, and delivery management.
+ 
+ ## Features
+ 
+ - 📊 Real-time delivery tracking and analytics
+ - 🚚 Deliverer management and assignment
+ - 📱 Responsive design for all devices
+ - 🔐 Role-based access control
+ - 🌐 Internationalization support
+ - 📈 Interactive charts and data visualization
+ - 🔍 Advanced search and filtering
+ - ⌨️ Command palette for quick navigation
+ - 🎨 Customizable themes (light/dark mode)
+ - 🧩 Component library with Storybook documentation
+ 
+ ## Tech Stack
+ 
+ ### Frontend
+ - React 18
+ - React Router
+ - Tailwind CSS
+ - Chart.js
+ - React Table
+ - React Joyride
+ - i18next for internationalization
+ - Lucide Icons
+ - Storybook
+ 
+ ### Backend
+ - Node.js
+ - Express
+ - MongoDB
+ - JWT authentication
+ - Jest for testing
+ 
+ ## Project Structure
+ 
+ The project follows a feature-slice architecture:
+ 
+ ```
+ src/
+   ├── components/        # Reusable UI components
+   │   ├── ui/            # Base UI primitives
+   │   └── ...
+   ├── features/          # Feature modules
+   │   ├── deliveries/    # Delivery management feature
+   │   ├── deliverers/    # Deliverer management feature
+   │   └── ...
+   ├── hooks/             # Custom React hooks
+   ├── lib/               # Utility functions
+   ├── services/          # API services
+   │   ├── api/           # API modules
+   │   └── http.js        # HTTP client
+   ├── stories/           # Storybook stories
+   └── ...
+ ```
+ 
+ ## Getting Started
+ 
+ ### Prerequisites
+ - Node.js 18+
+ - npm or yarn
+ 
+ ### Installation
+ 
+ 1. Clone the repository
+ ```bash
+ git clone https://github.com/yourusername/logistics-dashboard.git
+ cd logistics-dashboard
+ ```
+ 
+ 2. Install dependencies
+ ```bash
+ # Install root dependencies
+ npm install
+ 
+ # Install frontend dependencies
+ cd frontend
+ npm install
+ 
+ # Install backend dependencies
+ cd ../backend
+ npm install
+ ```
+ 
+ 3. Set up environment variables
+ ```bash
+ # In the backend directory
+ cp .env.example .env
+ # Edit .env with your configuration
+ ```
+ 
+ 4. Start the development servers
+ ```bash
+ # Start backend server
+ cd backend
+ npm run dev
+ 
+ # In another terminal, start frontend server
+ cd frontend
+ npm start
+ ```
+ 
+ 5. Open your browser and navigate to `http://localhost:3000`
+ 
+ ## Development
+ 
+ ### Available Scripts
+ 
+ #### Frontend
+ - `npm start` - Start development server
+ - `npm run build` - Build for production
+ - `npm test` - Run tests
+ - `npm run lint` - Run ESLint
+ - `npm run format` - Format code with Prettier
+ - `npm run storybook` - Start Storybook server
+ - `npm run build-storybook` - Build Storybook
+ 
+ #### Backend
+ - `npm run dev` - Start development server
+ - `npm run build` - Build for production
+ - `npm start` - Start production server
+ - `npm test` - Run tests
+ - `npm run seed` - Seed the database
+ 
+ ### Code Quality
+ 
+ This project uses:
+ - ESLint for code linting
+ - Prettier for code formatting
+ - Husky for pre-commit hooks
+ - lint-staged for running linters on staged files
+ - GitHub Actions for CI/CD
+ 
+ ## Contributing
+ 
+ 1. Fork the repository
+ 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature`)
+ 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -m 'Add some amazing feature'`)
+ 4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/amazing-feature`)
+ 5. Open a Pull Request
+ 
+ ## License
+ 
+ This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the LICENSE file for details.
